text:
Oh that sounds more hopeful. hwloc-2.4.1 is what I `make`-d locally. But the error from Hwloc.jl is like so:
```Precompiling project...

1 dependency errored

julia> using Hwloc

ERROR: LoadError: UndefVarError: libhwloc not defined
in expression starting at /Users/me/.julia/packages/Hwloc/N8RN6/src/Hwloc.jl:1
ERROR: Failed to precompile Hwloc [0e44f5e4-bd66-52a0-8798-143a42290a1d] to /Users/me/.julia/compiled/v1.7/Hwloc/jl_iaaaJw.```

text: I don't think all the BinaryBuilder packages have been rebuilt for Apple ARM yet, so you won't be able to use the provided jlls.

elements.text: I don't think all the BinaryBuilder packages have been rebuilt for Apple ARM yet, so you won't be able to use the provided jlls.

text: Ok. And this rebuild is something that must be done centrally, or it a piecewise thing where random people might do one or two packages at a time?

elements.text: Ok. And this rebuild is something that must be done centrally, or it a piecewise thing where random people might do one or two packages at a time?

text: And, can I easily replace the _jll with a locally built version? I don’t really know what I’m doing but maybe there are instructions somewhere…

elements.text: And, can I easily replace the _jll with a locally built version? I don’t really know what I’m doing but maybe there are instructions somewhere…

text: Ah yes, when I said supported_platforms() and arm, i mostly meant linux+arm.

elements.text: Ah yes, when I said supported_platforms() and arm, i mostly meant linux+arm.

text: The rebuild needs be done centrally, but can be triggered one at a time by contributors. But I'm not sure if our build infrastructure is geared up for this yet. As you can imagine, all of this is new.

elements.text: The rebuild needs be done centrally, but can be triggered one at a time by contributors. But I'm not sure if our build infrastructure is geared up for this yet. As you can imagine, all of this is new.

text: I think the Apple ARM support won't be official until at least 1.7, and there may be some issues with backwards compatibility of the Apple ARM platform string with older releases (I think it will force a minimum version of either 1.5 or 1.6 if it is present in a jll maybe). <@U66GD0880> would probably know more.

elements.text: I think the Apple ARM support won't be official until at least 1.7, and there may be some issues with backwards compatibility of the Apple ARM platform string with older releases (I think it will force a minimum version of either 1.5 or 1.6 if it is present in a jll maybe).

text: Yes, Ian is correct. If there are packages you would like to push forward, open an issue on Yggdrasil and we can work on those packages one by one until we’re ready to rebuild things automatically.

elements.text: Yes, Ian is correct. If there are packages you would like to push forward, open an issue on Yggdrasil and we can work on those packages one by one until we’re ready to rebuild things automatically.
